summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 between attorney Teri Gibbs and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding scheduling interviews for two clients who are alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss coordinating in-person and video conference interviews for the victims, providing photographs from 2004 for identification, and arranging travel logistics.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.context: Attorney who is coordinating interviews for two clients who allege they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein. She is communicating with the U.S. Attorney's office to schedule meetings.

persons.name: Colleen Mullen
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence regarding victim interviews, appears to be part of the legal team representing the alleged victims.

persons.name: Arick Fudali
persons.context: Identified as a New York attorney who will accompany one of the alleged victims to her in-person interview with the U.S. Attorney's office.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence regarding victim interviews, appears to be part of the legal team representing the alleged victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (19 Cr. 490 (RMB)). Two clients allege they were assaulted by him in or around June 2004.

events.title: Scheduled in-person victim interview
events.description: An in-person interview is scheduled for one alleged victim (Ms. [redacted]) with the U.S. Attorney's office in New York. Attorney Arick Fudali will accompany her.

events.description: A video conference interview is scheduled for another alleged victim (Ms. [redacted]) who is located in a different time zone (Okinawa mentioned).

events.title: Alleged assaults by Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Two clients allege they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.

keyFacts: Two new alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein are coming forward, represented by attorneys Teri Gibbs, Lisa Bloom, Colleen Mullen, and Arick Fudali.
The alleged assaults are said to have occurred in or around June 2004.
The attorneys provided photographs of the victims from 2004 to the U.S. Attorney's office and requested confirmation if they appear in photos seized from Epstein's home.
Interviews with the victims were scheduled for late August 2019, one in-person in New York and one via video conference due to the victim's location in a different time zone (Okinawa mentioned).
The correspondence is part of case 19 Cr. 490 (RMB), indicating it relates to the federal criminal prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein.
